004
005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.button;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Command;
008import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Subsystem;
009import java.util.function.BooleanSupplier;
010
011/**
012 * This class provides an easy way to link commands to OI inputs.
013 *
014 * <p>It is very easy to link a button to a command. For instance, you could link the trigger button
015 * of a joystick to a "score" command.
016 *
017 * <p>This class represents a subclass of Trigger that is specifically aimed at buttons on an
018 * operator interface as a common use case of the more generalized Trigger objects. This is a simple
019 * wrapper around Trigger with the method names renamed to fit the Button object use.
020 */
021public class Button extends Trigger {
022  /**
023   * Default constructor; creates a button that is never pressed.
024   *
025   * @deprecated Replace with {@code new Button(() -> false) }.
026   */
027  @Deprecated(since = "2023")
028  public Button() {}
029
030  /**
031   * Creates a new button with the given condition determining whether it is pressed.
032   *
033   * @param isPressed returns whether or not the trigger should be active
034   */
035  public Button(BooleanSupplier isPressed) {
036    super(isPressed);
037  }
038
039  /**
040   * Starts the given command whenever the button is newly pressed.
041   *
042   * @param command the command to start
043   * @return this button, so calls can be chained
044   */
045  public Button whenPressed(final Command command) {
046    whenActive(command);
047    return this;
048  }
049
050  /**
051   * Runs the given runnable whenever the button is newly pressed.
052   *
053   * @param toRun the runnable to run
054   * @param requirements the required subsystems
055   * @return this button, so calls can be chained
056   */
057  public Button whenPressed(final Runnable toRun, Subsystem... requirements) {
058    whenActive(toRun, requirements);
059    return this;
060  }
061
062  /**
063   * Constantly starts the given command while the button is held.
064   *
065   * <p>{@link Command#schedule()} will be called repeatedly while the button is held, and will be
066   * canceled when the button is released.
067   *
068   * @param command the command to start
069   * @return this button, so calls can be chained
070   */
071  public Button whileHeld(final Command command) {
072    whileActiveContinuous(command);
073    return this;
074  }
075
076  /**
077   * Constantly runs the given runnable while the button is held.
078   *
079   * @param toRun the runnable to run
080   * @param requirements the required subsystems
081   * @return this button, so calls can be chained
082   */
083  public Button whileHeld(final Runnable toRun, Subsystem... requirements) {
084    whileActiveContinuous(toRun, requirements);
085    return this;
086  }
087
088  /**
089   * Starts the given command when the button is first pressed, and cancels it when it is released,
090   * but does not start it again if it ends or is otherwise interrupted.
091   *
092   * @param command the command to start
093   * @return this button, so calls can be chained
094   */
095  public Button whenHeld(final Command command) {
096    whileActiveOnce(command);
097    return this;
098  }
099
100  /**
101   * Starts the command when the button is released. The command is set to be interruptible.
102   *
103   * @param command the command to start
104   * @return this button, so calls can be chained
105   */
106  public Button whenReleased(final Command command) {
107    whenInactive(command);
108    return this;
109  }
110
111  /**
112   * Runs the given runnable when the button is released.
113   *
114   * @param toRun the runnable to run
115   * @param requirements the required subsystems
116   * @return this button, so calls can be chained
117   */
118  public Button whenReleased(final Runnable toRun, Subsystem... requirements) {
119    whenInactive(toRun, requirements);
120    return this;
121  }
122
123  /**
124   * Toggles the command whenever the button is pressed (on then off then on). The command is set to
125   * be interruptible.
126   *
127   * @param command the command to start
128   * @return this button, so calls can be chained
129   */
130  public Button toggleWhenPressed(final Command command) {
131    toggleWhenActive(command);
132    return this;
133  }
134
135  /**
136   * Cancels the command when the button is pressed.
137   *
138   * @param command the command to start
139   * @return this button, so calls can be chained
140   */
141  public Button cancelWhenPressed(final Command command) {
142    cancelWhenActive(command);
143    return this;
144  }
145}
